_header: A cross was made all of red / In the beginning of my book
Note:
Compare the three lines in Cambridge UK, Trinity College O.3.12 (1184), extra flyleaf. For Prohemium, see 1206; for Envoy, see 6837. Singer (1928)
XSinger, Dorothea Waley. Catalogue of Latin and Vernacular Alchemical Manuscripts. 3 vols. Brussels: Lamertin, 1928-31, 1059.
Subjects: prologues; Glanville, De Proprietatibus Rerum, prologue to
_description: The Translator’s Prologue to Trevisa’s version of Glanville’s De Proprietatibus Rerum — six cross-rhymed quatrains.

CULIi541.First Lines:
A cros was maad of al reedeIn þe bigynnyng of my
                    book…
CULIi541.Last Lines:
…And þis game reule & rede ledeAnd brynge
                    it to a good ende
CULIi541.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 94-5.

BLAdd27944.First Lines:
[+] croys was maad al of reedIn þe bigynnynge of my
                    bookThat is clepid god me spedeIn þe firste lessoun þat I
                    took…
BLAdd27944.Last Lines:
…And þis game reule and ledeAnd bringe hit to a good
                    ende
BLAdd27944.Editions:
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 241-2.

BLHar614.First Lines:
Croys was maad al of reedIn þe bigynnyng of my bookThat
                    is clepid god me speedIn þe first lessoum þat I
                    took…
BLHar614.Last Lines:
…And þis game wel rule & leedAnd bringe it to a good
                    eende
BLHar614.Note:
Preceded by rubric ‘In nomine patris & filii & spiritu
                        sancti Amen’ (f. 4vc); written as verse, by same hand
                    as the index; text begins f. 5ra.
BLHar614.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble. 
             N. Y. Nation,
         vol. 87, no. 2248 (July 30, 1908): 92; repr.
Perry (1925)
XPerry,  Aaron Jenkins. 
             John Trevisa: Dialogus inter Militem et Clericum, Richard
                Fitzralph’s ‘Defensio Curatorum’ and Methodius: ‘Þe
                Bygynnyng of Þe World and Þe Ende of Worldes’.
EETS
         o.s. 16 (1925); repr. 1987, cxxix.

BLHar4789.First Lines:
A CRoys was made al of reedeIn þe bygynnyng of my
                    booke…
BLHar4789.Last Lines:
…In þis game reule & ledeAnd brynge yt to a good
                    ende
BLHar4789.Note:
Preceded by rubric, In nomine patris & filii & spiritus
                        sancti Amen / Assit principio sancta maria meo; followed by black ink,
                        Qui habet aures audiendi audiat & cetera and rubric title to
                    prose text (f. 1ra).
BLHar4789.Attributed Title:
Incipit prohemium de proprietatibus rerum / Bartholomei Anglici de
                        ordine fratrum minorum (f. 1ra)

Plimpton263.First Lines:
[A] Croys was made al of redeIn þe begynnynge of my
                    bok…
Plimpton263.Last Lines:
…And þis game reule and ledeAnd brynge hit to a goode
                    ende
Plimpton263.Note:
Preceded by ‘In nomine patris & filii & spiritu sancti
                    amen. Assit principio sancta Maria meo’ (f. 9ra).
Plimpton263.Facsimiles:
Plimpton,  George A. 
             The Education of Chaucer: Illustrated from the Schoolbooks in Use in
                his Time.
         London: Oxford University Press, 1935: plate V.
Plimpton263.Editions:
Plimpton,  George A. 
             The Education of Chaucer: Illustrated from the Schoolbooks in Use in
                his Time.
         London: Oxford University Press, 1935: 34-5.

PierpontM875.First Lines:
[A] Croys was mad all of reedIn þe bigynnynge of my
                    book…
PierpontM875.Last Lines:
…And þis game reule and ledeAnd brynge hit to a good
                    ende
